Sequence Information.Target Organism: No MICs found in DRAMP database
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Insecticidal neurotoxin that modulates the insect Nav channel (DmNaV1/tipE (para/tipE)) in a unique manner, with both the activation and inactivation processes being affected. The voltage dependence of activation is shifted toward more hyperpolarized potentials (analogous to site 4 toxins) and a non- inactivating persistent sodium current is induced (site 3-like action). Interestingly, both effects take place in a voltage- dependent manner, producing a bell-shaped curve between -80 and 0 mV. Compared to beta/delta-agatoxin-1 to -3, this toxin appears to affect the insect sodium channel only weakly.##Miscellaneous

Literature.Title: A novel strategy for the identification of toxinlike structures inspider venoM.
Literature.Author: Kozlov S. A., Malyavka A., McCutchen B., Lu A., Schepers E., Herrmann R., Grishin E.V.

Literature.Title: Unique bell-shaped voltage-dependent modulation of Na+ channel gatingby novel insect-selective toxins from the spider Agelena orientaliS.
Literature.Author: Billen B., Vassilevski A., Nikolsky A., Debaveye S. , Tytgat J., Grishin E.
